Chicken Alfredo Crepes

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to the delectable world of Chicken Alfredo Crepes, where classic Italian flavors meet the delicate charm of French cooking. This recipe combines the creamy richness of Alfredo sauce with tender, shredded chicken, all enveloped in light and airy crepes. Perfect for brunch, a cozy dinner, or a special occasion, this dish is sure to impress your family and friends. In just a few simple steps, you can create a restaurant-quality meal right in your kitchen. Whether you’re a seasoned chef or a cooking novice, this Chicken Alfredo Crepes recipe will guide you through every step, ensuring a delicious outcome. Plus, with ingredients that are easy to find and a preparation time that won’t keep you in the kitchen for hours, you’ll want to make this dish a staple in your culinary repertoire. Get ready to delight your taste buds and elevate your dining experience with these delightful crepes!

Ingredients

all-purpose flour

For a lighter crepe, you can substitute half of the all-purpose flour with cake flour. If you're looking for a gluten-free option, use a gluten-free flour blend instead.

milk

Whole milk will give you the richest flavor, but you can use low-fat or almond milk as a substitute if you want to reduce calories. For creamier crepes, consider using half-and-half.

eggs

Fresh eggs will yield the best flavor and texture. If you're vegan or allergic, you can substitute with 1/4 cup of unsweetened applesauce or 1/4 cup of silken tofu blended until smooth.

cooked chicken breast

Rotisserie chicken is a great shortcut and adds flavor. For a vegetarian option, you can substitute shredded cooked mushrooms or tofu.

heavy cream

For a lighter sauce, you can use half-and-half or evaporated milk. Coconut cream is a great dairy-free substitute, lending a slightly tropical flavor.

parmesan cheese

Use freshly grated Parmesan for the best melt and flavor. If you're looking for a non-dairy option, try nutritional yeast for a cheesy flavor.

butter

Unsalted butter is preferred so you can control the saltiness. For a dairy-free option, use coconut oil or a vegan butter.

salt

Adjust the salt based on your dietary needs or preferences. You can also use garlic salt or onion salt for added flavor.

black pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper will give a more robust flavor than pre-ground. You can also substitute with white pepper for a milder taste.

garlic powder

You can use fresh minced garlic instead, about one clove for every 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder. Alternatively, garlic salt can be used, but reduce the regular salt in the recipe.

italian seasoning

If you don't have Italian seasoning, you can make your own blend using equal parts dried basil, oregano, thyme, and rosemary.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Crepe Batter

    In a mixing bowl, whisk together 1 cup of all-purpose flour, 1 cup of milk, 2 eggs, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper until the mixture is smooth and free of lumps. Allow the batter to rest for 10 minutes to let the gluten relax, which will result in tender crepes.

  • Step 2: Cook the Crepes

    Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and melt a small amount of butter (about 1/2 teaspoon). Pour a thin layer of the batter into the skillet, tilting the pan to swirl it around and cover the bottom evenly. Cook for 1-2 minutes until the edges start to lift and the crepe is lightly golden. Carefully flip the crepe and cook for another minute on the other side. Repeat the process with the remaining batter to make about 4 crepes.

  • Step 3: Make the Alfredo Sauce

    In a separate saucepan, combine 1/2 cup of heavy cream, 1/2 cup of grated Parmesan cheese, 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon of Italian seasoning, and 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper. Heat the mixture over low heat, stirring constantly until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth. Be careful not to boil the sauce, as this can cause it to separate.

  • Step 4: Add Chicken to Sauce

    Once the Alfredo sauce is smooth, add 1 cup of shredded cooked chicken breast. Stir well to coat the chicken in the creamy sauce. Allow it to heat through for a few minutes.

  • Step 5: Assemble the Crepes

    To serve, take a cooked crepe and place it on a plate. Spoon a generous amount of the chicken Alfredo mixture onto one side of the crepe. Fold the other side over the filling to create a half-moon shape. If desired, drizzle extra Alfredo sauce over the top before serving.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I measure ingredients accurately?

Use dry measuring cups for solids like flour and liquid measuring cups for liquids like milk. For precise measurements, level off dry ingredients with a straight edge and check the liquid measurement at eye level.

What is the purpose of letting the crepe batter rest?

Resting the batter allows the gluten to relax, resulting in more tender crepes. It also gives time for any air bubbles to escape, leading to a smoother texture.

How can I prevent my crepes from sticking to the pan?

Make sure to use a non-stick skillet and melt a little butter before pouring the batter. If the first crepe sticks, your pan may not be hot enough or you may need more butter.

What can I use to fill my crepes besides chicken Alfredo?

You can fill crepes with a variety of ingredients such as sautéed vegetables, cheeses, sweet fillings like Nutella or fruits, or even scrambled eggs for a breakfast option.

How do I know when to flip the crepe?

Look for the edges of the crepe to lift slightly and the center to appear set but still slightly moist. This usually takes about 1-2 minutes on medium heat.

What should I do if my crepes are tearing?

If your crepes are tearing, your batter might be too thick or the pan might be too hot. Try thinning the batter with a little more milk and ensure the skillet is at medium heat.

How do I safely handle hot pans and melted butter?

Always use oven mitts when handling hot pans and be cautious when adding butter to prevent splattering. Allow the pan to cool slightly before cleaning with water.

Can I make the crepes ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the crepes in advance, stack them with parchment paper in between to prevent sticking, and store them in the fridge for up to 2 days or freeze them for up to a month.

What type of chicken should I use for the filling?

Cooked chicken breast is ideal, but you can also use rotisserie chicken for convenience. Just shred it before adding it to the sauce.

How can I tell when the chicken Alfredo sauce is ready?

The sauce is ready when the cheese is fully melted and the mixture is smooth. Stir continuously on low heat to prevent burning.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For gluten-free options, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free flour blend. To make it lighter, use low-fat milk and reduce the amount of cream. For a vegetarian version, omit the chicken and add sautéed mushrooms or spinach for added flavor.

Pairings

Pair the Chicken Alfredo Crepes with a light side salad dressed with lemon vinaigrette to balance the richness. For beverages, consider a crisp Chardonnay or a sparkling water with a lemon wedge to cleanse the palate.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the crepes warm, garnished with freshly chopped parsley or basil for a pop of color. You can also sprinkle additional grated Parmesan on top for an extra cheesy finish. Consider serving with a side of garlic bread for a comforting meal.

Chicken Alfredo Crepes

35 min
$12.99
800 kcal
Difficulty: 30%
Servings: 2

Allergens:

Description

Delicate crepes filled with creamy chicken Alfredo sauce, perfect for a satisfying meal.

Ingredients

  • all-purpose flour: 1 cup
  • milk: 1 cup
  • eggs: 2
  • cooked chicken breast: 1 cup, shredded
  • heavy cream: 1/2 cup
  • parmesan cheese: 1/2 cup, grated
  • butter: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: 1/2 teaspoon
  • black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
  • garlic powder: 1/4 teaspoon
  • italian seasoning: 1/4 teaspoon
